div.p: Yours of the 30 tilt recd this morning your of the 26 I recd on Monday after I wrote you thank you for your frequent letters and they have as yet come to hand in good time the key of the tool che was in my packet you had better get the Gunsmith to open it and make a new key I have been very busy this past week, but the office does not pay as well as it did last year however I may get a better position soon as I reach pretty high with all the officers, I think I wrote you that Genl Arme wanted me in his office but Mr. Lemeny was unwilling to let me go at present I am glad that sister M did not

hurt herself mabsically when she fell. Give her my love when you write - I hope she had a pleasant visit am sorry that Ann is unable to do his work but you had better get along as well as you can untill she gets better as girls are hard to get and she seemed to be a good one the weather this past week has been very gloomy with much drizzly rain and rain and cobl yert day a heary white port but the trees still have thin leaves tho colored I am very sorry that Hatties head troubles here so much she had better try wahoo, and each regularly Charlies cold is bad just now when she wants to practice she must be careful and not get another one or she will lose this whole winter

I want the girls to study but not too hard I think i shall be able to get money for their schooling which is all inportant I think I can make money here prollising Lusi but will not give up a curl county for a uncurl county I expect to send you a draft next week I did not break the $100 bill I brot downas I got money to pay my board bill from my office I hope Annil will soon be able to go to school. Lii I suppose is getting along well I am glad she well a Negro has scared Ridlhin I hope he will not make it up with him so as to keep him out of the stable. My best respects to Mr Woods and the young ladies I wish I was at home to show them some courtesy - Kiss all
Mrs W R Hackley Your aff Husband
